excerpt: Matera is a city on a rocky outcrop in the region of Basilicata, in southern Italy. It includes the Sassi area, a complex of cave dwellings carved into the mountainside. Evacuated in 1952 due to poor living conditions, the Sassi now houses museums like the Casa Grotta di Vico Solitario, with period furniture and artisan tools. Nearby rock churches include St. Lucia alle Malve, with 13th-century frescoes.
detail_description: Matera, located in the Basilicata region of southern Italy, is a city known for its unique Sassi area, where cave dwellings are carved into the mountainside. Once evacuated due to poor living conditions, these caves now house museums and rock churches with ancient frescoes. Matera's history as a once-shamed and neglected area has been transformed into a place of cultural significance. The city's bread is also renowned for its exceptional flavor and archaeological ties to Mediterranean culinary traditions.
name: Matera
address: 75100 Province of Matera, Italy

excerpt: Subterranean cistern carved from rock beneath a busy plaza in the 19th century, with guided tours.
detail_description: The "Palombaro Lungo" is a remarkable subterranean cistern located beneath the bustling Piazza Vittorio in Matera. Dating back to the 19th century, this expansive water reserve was designed to collect drinking water for the residents of "Sasso Caveoso." With a depth of 15 meters and a capacity of approximately 5,000 cubic meters, it represents an impressive feat of hydraulic engineering.
name: Palombaro lungo
address: Piazza Vittorio Veneto, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

excerpt: Multimedia demonstration in a historic stone house detailing the history of the Sassi & Matera.
detail_description: Casa Noha is a historic stone house in Matera that offers a 25-minute multimedia exhibit detailing the history of the Sassi. The video experience portrays the deplorable living conditions and extreme poverty that were once prevalent in the sassi, where families lived alongside their animals in small, dark spaces. Over time, the government relocated some of the population, leading to the transformation of cave dwellings into today's hotels, shops, and restaurants.
name: Casa Noha
address: Recinto Cavone, 9, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

detail_description: Belvedere di Piazza Giovanni Pascoli is a must-visit terrace in the Upper Town of Matera, offering an incredible panoramic view of the iconic cave cityscape. It provides a stunning vantage point to appreciate the scale and expanse of Matera's cave houses. The viewpoint at Piazzetta Pascoli between two districts offers a unique perspective to observe the city's particularities.
name: Belvedere di Piazza Giovanni Pascoli
address: Piazzetta Pascoli, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

detail_description: Sasso Caveoso is a must-see in Matera, located in the labyrinthian area of the city. It houses Musma, Italy's most important sculpture museum, showcasing works inside Palazzo Pomarici and excavated chambers. The neighboring Sasso Barisano district and Murgia Materana Park offer additional exploration opportunities.
name: Sasso Caveoso
address: Piazza S. Pietro Caveoso, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

excerpt: Museum featuring sculptures, pottery & other artifacts, some of which are displayed in cave houses.
detail_description: Located in the Sasso Caveoso on Via San Giacomo, MUSMA - Museo della Scultura Contemporanea is a unique museum housed in the 16th-century Palazzo Pomarici. It stands out as the most significant Italian museum dedicated entirely to sculpture. The museum offers an immersive experience, with its collection of contemporary sculptures displayed within both the palace's built-up areas and extensive excavated hypogea.
name: MUSMA - Museo della Scultura Contemporanea
address: Via S. Giacomo, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

excerpt: Sassi di Matera is known for its prehistoric cave dwellings atop a ravine overlooking the Torrente Gravina tributary. The Sasso Caveoso area is home to Madonna de Idris, a medieval rock church with frescoes. In Sasso Barisano, the Church of Sant'Agostino contains a 1770 pipe organ, while cultural events are held in Casa Cava, a theater carved from a quarry. Restaurants are plentiful along Via Bruno Buozzi.
detail_description: Sassi di Matera is a historic district famous for its ancient cave dwellings perched on a cliff overlooking the Torrente Gravina river. The area features notable attractions such as the Madonna de Idris, a medieval church adorned with frescoes, and the Church of Sant'Agostino with its impressive 1770 pipe organ. Cultural events take place at Casa Cava, a unique theater carved from a quarry.
name: Sassi di Matera
address: 75100 Matera, Province of Matera, Italy

detail_description: Sassi is a captivating destination known for its ancient dwellings and churches carved into the rocky mountainside, which now house modern boutiques, restaurants, bars, and hotels. With a history spanning up to 7000 years, the stone walls of Sassi tell stories of the past while seamlessly blending with contemporary establishments. The current inhabitants are dedicated to preserving its rich heritage within a modern setting.
name: Sassi
address: 75100 Matera MT, Italy

excerpt: Historical site featuring a recreated cave dwelling with period furnishings, tools & artifacts.
detail_description: Casa Grotta nei Sassi di Matera is a historical site that offers a glimpse into the past with its recreated cave dwelling featuring period furnishings, tools, and artifacts. As you explore Matera on foot, you'll come across this old house inside a cave on Vico Solitario street. The Casa Grotta provides an immersive experience as it is perfectly preserved and furnished with items from the 1950s, showcasing the living conditions of peasants during that time.
name: Casa Grotta nei Sassi di Matera
address: Vico Solitario, 11, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

excerpt: Unique Catholic church built into a rocky hilltop & featuring a crypt with preserved frescoes.
detail_description: The Church of Saint Mary of Idris is an exceptional Catholic church built into a rocky hilltop. It boasts a stunning exterior and features preserved frescoes in the crypt. Although small and not well-preserved inside, it remains a unique and hauntingly beautiful example of Christian history. Visitors should note that photos are not allowed during visits, which cost 3.50 for just a few minutes.
name: Church of Saint Mary of Idris
address: Via Madonna dell'Idris, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

detail_description: Belvedere Luigi Guerricchio, also known as "Three Arches," is a popular viewpoint located in Piazza Vittorio Veneto, offering stunning views of the Sassi and the Cathedral of Matera. Visitors can take a scenic hike in Parco Regionale della Murgia Materana to reach this hillside vantage point. The area is renowned for its picturesque landscapes and unique troglodyte settlement, making it a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
name: Belvedere Luigi Guerricchio (Belvedere dei Tre Archi)
address: Piazza Vittorio Veneto, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

detail_description: Chiesa di Santa Lucia alle Malve is a significant site in Matera, dating back to the eighth century. It was the first female monastic settlement of the Benedictine Order and has played a crucial role in the city's historical and urban development over a millennium. The former monastic complex features entrances leading into internal cavities along the rocky wall.
name: Chiesa di Santa Lucia alle Malve
address: Rione Malve, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

detail_description: Piazza Vittorio Veneto is located in the newer part of the old city and offers a stunning Belvedere at Belvedere Luigi Guerricchio, providing breathtaking views. In the late afternoon and early evening, it becomes a bustling hub of activity, attracting locals and visitors alike. It's a great spot to enjoy alfresco coffees or wine while soaking up the lively atmosphere.
name: Piazza Vittorio Veneto
address: 75100 Matera MT, Italy

excerpt: Regional cheeses, pasta & grilled meats in a stylish space carved into the rock, plus a terrace.
detail_description: Trattoria del Caveoso is a stylish restaurant carved into the rock, offering regional cheeses, pasta, and grilled meats. The elegant space features a gorgeous terrace open during the summer months. With a focus on seasonal and locally sourced fare rooted in classic Basilicata cuisine, the menu changes with the seasons.
name: Trattoria del Caveoso
address: Via Bruno Buozzi, 21, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

detail_description: Belvedere Murgia Timone is a breathtaking panoramic point located in the heart of Murgia Materana Park, offering an awe-inspiring view of the Sassi di Matera. It provides a complete vantage point to admire and contemplate the landscape, visit nearby rock churches, or explore the entrenched Neolithic village of Murgia Timone.
name: Belvedere Murgia Timone
address: Contrada Murgia Timone, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

detail_description: Chiesa di S. Antonio Abate al Sasso Barisano is a part of the holy sites in Sasso Barisano, Matera. It's located near Chiesa di Madonna delle Virtu and Chiesa di San Nicola del Greci, forming a monastic complex with dozens of caves covering two floors. The church was built around the 10th century and underwent restoration in the 17th century.
name: Chiesa di Sant'Antonio Abate al Sasso Barisano
address: Via Sant'Antonio Abate, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

detail_description: In the historic city of Matera, Italy, visitors can explore the fascinating Chiesa di San Pietro Caveoso. Despite its name, this church is not carved into the rock like many others in the area. Dating back to the 12th and 13th centuries, it features a baroque facade with three portals adorned with statues. The interior boasts a central tuff nave and an eighteenth-century altar at the back.
name: Chiesa di San Pietro Caveoso
address: Piazza S. Pietro Caveoso, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

excerpt: Medieval & modern art displays in a palazzo from 1672, with an ornately carved, mellow-stone facade.
detail_description: Palazzo Lanfranchi, a 17th-century seminary turned art museum, is a must-visit in Matera. The Museo Nazionale d'Arte Medievale e Moderna della Regione Basilicata is housed here and features the Pinacoteca DErrico with religious paintings by southern artists. Additionally, the Centro Carlo Levi showcases works by the 20th-century artist and writer.
name: Palazzo Lanfranchi
address: Piazzetta Pascoli, 1, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

detail_description: The Church of Saint Peter 'Barisano' is a 13th-century church located in the Sassi area of Matera. Despite being plundered in the 1960s and 70s, it still holds historical significance. The church is entirely carved out of rock and features catacombs, making it the largest of the three rock churches in Matera. Visitors can purchase a combined ticket to explore this and other churches as well as other casa attractions.
name: Church of Saint Peter 'Barisano'
address: Via S. Pietro Barisano, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

detail_description: Nestled in the enchanting city of Matera, the Matera Olive Oil Museum (MOOM) stands as a testament to the rich heritage and cultural significance of olive oil in this historic region. This museum invites visitors to delve into the fascinating history and production processes that have shaped local cuisine and economy over centuries. As you wander through its exhibits, you'll gain insights into how olive oil has woven itself into the very fabric of life in Basilicata.
name: MOOM / Matera Olive Oil Museum
address: Vico I Casalnuovo, 3, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

detail_description: Dimora Ulmo ristorante is located in a beautifully restored palace in Matera, showcasing its noble heritage and contemporary art collection. The restaurant offers over 600 wines and a menu featuring traditional and gourmet dishes influenced by Chef Michele Castelli's local origins and experience in three-Michelin-starred kitchens. The project is led by a young, passionate team with expertise from top culinary establishments, creating an elegant and exclusive dining experience.
name: Dimora Ulmo ristorante
address: Via Pennino, 28, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

detail_description: Vitantonio Lombardo Ristorante is a unique dining experience in Matera, Italy. Housed in a converted cave in the Sassi district, it offers an elegant setting for gourmet dining. After your meal, take a leisurely stroll through the historic center and enjoy the haunting beauty of Matera at night. The chef's cuisine reflects a strong connection to the region, featuring creative dishes that showcase local recipes and ingredients from Lucania.
name: Vitantonio Lombardo Ristorante
address: Via Madonna delle Virt, 13, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

detail_description: The Laboratory Museum of Rural Life in Matera is a fascinating display of tools used by various craftsmen and workers in the area, housed within a restored 16th century building. Visitors can explore an extensive collection including magazines from the 1930s, old furniture, tools, equipment, and even a complete 1900s barber shop. This museum offers a unique opportunity to delve into the lifestyle of people over a century ago.
name: Laboratory Museum of Rural Life
address: Via S. Giovanni Vecchio, 60, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

detail_description: Piazza S. Pietro Caveoso is an important church in Matera, dating back to the 13th century and known for its beautiful Baroque-style facade and frescoed timber ceiling. The highlight of a visit here is the incredible frescoes on the wooden ceiling, which hides an original 18th-century ceiling. This church stands out as it's not carved into tufa rock like many others in Matera.
name: Piazza S. Pietro Caveoso
address: 75100 Matera MT, Italy

excerpt: This massive castle on Lapillo's hill, was left unfinished after the unpopular Count Tramontano.
detail_description: Tramontano Castle, located on Lapillo's hill in Matera, Italy, is a 16th-century fortress with three large towers. Originally designed with twelve towers, the castle was left unfinished after Count Tramontano's unpopular rule. Although visitors cannot enter the castle, it is still worth a visit for its historical significance and archaeological findings dating back to Roman or pre-historic times.
name: Castello Tramontano
address: Via del Castello, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

detail_description: Located at Via Domenico Ridola, 36, I Vizi degli Angeli - Laboratorio di Gelateria Artigianale is a popular gelato shop that attracts long lines of eager customers. The selection of ingredients is carefully chosen and the production process is meticulous, resulting in genuine and artisanal gelato.
name: I Vizi degli Angeli - Laboratorio di Gelateria Artigianale
address: Via Domenico Ridola, n.36, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

detail_description: La Lopa is a standout restaurant in Matera, offering traditional dishes like Fave e Cicoria, Crapiata, peperoni cruschi, and various pasta options. What sets it apart is the cozy cave cinema where diners can watch films set in Matera for free. The warm atmosphere and locally sourced ingredients add to the experience. Despite initial hesitation about prices, visitors were glad they gave it a try and found it to be one of their favorite spots in Matera.
name: La Lopa
address: Via Bruno Buozzi, 13, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

detail_description: Zipa Caf is a trendy and unique spot that offers an incredible experience. Located overlooking a ravine, the caf features bean bag chairs scattered among rocky alcoves, creating an edgy vibe. The small menu includes seven unique cocktails, and while the food is basic, it is perfectly executed. Seating is outside in a small stone courtyard with beanbags for lounging. Despite its small size, the caf's cool atmosphere and amazing view make it worth the wait for a table.
name: zipa caf
address: Via Madonna dell'Idris, 15, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

detail_description: Via Madonna delle Virt offers stunning views of the Gravina Torrent and the Sasso Caveoso, with the picturesque Church of San Pietro Caveoso and its square in the foreground. Renowned for its panoramic vistas, this street also holds significance as a filming location for Mel Gibson's movie 'The Passion of the Christ,' with several scenes shot here.
name: Via Madonna delle Virt
address: 75100 Matera MT, Italy

detail_description: Via S. Pietro Barisano is a charming street in the historic center of Matera, Italy. It is lined with ancient cave dwellings that have been converted into unique accommodations, restaurants, and shops. The street offers a glimpse into the city's rich history and provides an opportunity to experience the traditional architecture of the Sassi di Matera. Visitors can wander along Via S.
name: Via S. Pietro Barisano
address: 75100 Matera MT, Italy

detail_description: Festa della Madonna della Bruna is an annual week-long celebration held in Matera, Italy, to honor the city's patron saint. The festivities take place from July 2nd and include market stalls, processions, fireworks, and live music throughout the town. This tradition has been observed for over 600 years since it was established by Pope Urban VI in 1389.
name: Festa della Madonna della Bruna
address: Piazza Vittorio Veneto, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

excerpt: Simple quarters in a hotel set inside ancient cave dwellings, offering complimentary breakfast.
detail_description: Sextantio Le Grotte Della Civita is a hotel located in Matera, Italy, offering simple quarters set inside ancient cave dwellings. The rooms are elegantly designed with sturdy wooden furniture, hand-woven sheets, and thick candles that provide a sense of luxury. Despite the irregularities of the cave dwellings, the hotel provides modern amenities such as electricity, air conditioning, hot running water, and sleek bathtubs.
name: Sextantio Le Grotte Della Civita
address: Via Civita, 28, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

detail_description: Ipogeo MateraSum is a hidden gem in Matera, often overlooked by tourists. This underground attraction offers a unique experience, allowing visitors to explore 1200 square meters of historic Stassi, revealing a city beneath the city with houses, streets, and places of worship. While the entrance may be hard to find, it's well worth the visit. The site provides written explanations for a more digestible experience compared to the audio guide.
name: Ipogeo MateraSum
address: Recinto XX Settembre, 7, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

excerpt: Monumental 1200s cathedral with a skyline-dominating bell tower & ornate interior decorations.
detail_description: The Cattedrale di Maria Santissima della Bruna e Sant'Eustachio is a stunning 1200s cathedral with a commanding bell tower and intricate interior decorations. Situated high atop Piazza Duomo, it offers breathtaking panoramic views of Matera from the ridge between the two sassi districts. The city boasts numerous other remarkable churches, such as Santa Maria di Idris, San Pietro Barisano, and San Pietro Caveoso, each showcasing unique architectural features.
name: Cathedral of Maria Santissima of the Bruna & Sant'Eustachio
address: Piazza Duomo, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

detail_description: Nestled across from Piazzetta Pascoli, the Chiesa del Purgatorio, or Church of Suffering, captivates visitors with its unique convex facade and intriguing symbolism. This 18th-century church is adorned with a variety of death motifs, including skulls that serve as poignant reminders of mortality and the importance of living virtuously. The lower row features identical skulls while each in the upper row sports distinct headdresses, adding an artistic flair to its somber theme.
name: Chiesa del Purgatorio
address: Via Domenico Ridola, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

detail_description: Casa grotta Cera una volta... is a small museum located near Belvedere di Piazza Giovanni Pascoli, dedicated to preserving and showcasing the traditional Casa Grotta style of dwelling commonly found in Matera. This cave-like structure, carved into the hillside, served as a home or shelter for locals for centuries. The museum features a typical family dwelling with traditional furnishings and sculptures depicting daily life.
name: Casa grotta Cera una volta...
address: Via Fiorentini, 251, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

detail_description: Via Domenico Ridola is a bustling street in Matera, known for its vibrant bar scene and array of dining options. One popular spot, 'Area 8,' attracts locals and visitors alike. The area is always lively, drawing crowds throughout the year alongside Piazza Sedile. Visitors can explore an assortment of Lucanian products, as well as indulge in delicious ice creams and street food offerings along these charming streets.
name: Via Domenico Ridola
address: 75100 Matera MT, Italy

detail_description: Nestled in the historic Sassi di Matera, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, Ristorante Francesca offers a romantic fine dining experience. The restaurant's modern and chic interior provides an elegant contrast to its ancient surroundings. Specializing in Basilicata cuisine, the menu features locally inspired pasta dishes and regional delicacies such as fennel-flavored Lucania sausage and succulent lamb entrees, best enjoyed with a glass of Aglianico del Vulture wine.
name: Ristorante Francesca
address: Via Bruno Buozzi, 9, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

detail_description: Le Bubbole is a renowned restaurant in Matera, offering traditional Lucanian cuisine with a modern twist by chef Nicola Stella. The menu features a selection of seafood and land dishes made with local ingredients. Situated in Palazzo Gattini, the restaurant provides an enchanting dining experience. While service may be slow at times, the delicious food and charming atmosphere compensate for it.
name: Le Bubbole
address: Via S. Potito, 57 B, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

excerpt: Warm, old-world restaurant carved into a hillside offering pizza, pasta & mains, plus a wine list.
detail_description: Osteria al Casale is a charming restaurant located on the southeastern edge of town, offering a warm and old-world ambiance. The restaurant overlooks the picturesque Gravina gorge and provides outdoor dining with views of Murga park. The menu features simple yet flavorful Italian dishes, with a focus on using local ingredients to create delicious pasta and pizzas. Additionally, the centrally located bakery Casa del Pane is renowned for its local bread made from semolina grain.
name: Osteria al Casale
address: Via Madonna delle Virt, 29, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

excerpt: Compact, lively restaurant featuring sandwiches, pizza & snacks, plus a furnished terrace.
detail_description: Il Rusticone is a cozy and vibrant restaurant in Matera, known for its delicious pizza, sandwiches, and snacks. The restaurant offers a furnished terrace where guests can enjoy their meals. It's popular for its Puccia, a local specialty, and is considered one of the best places in Matera for good quality yet affordable fast food. In addition to pizza, Il Rusticone also serves taglieri (meat and cheese boards) and other street food delights made from high-quality ingredients.
name: Il Rusticone
address: Via San Biagio, 5, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

detail_description: 5 Lire Matera is a charming restaurant with a delightful surprise - a terrace overlooking the ancient sassi. The menu offers an ample selection of delicious pinsa, pizza, focaccia, and salads. Visitors praise the fresh ingredients and excellent service. The balcony at the back provides a stunning view of Matera, making it a perfect spot to enjoy an authentic Italian meal. Guests highly recommend this place for its great food and breathtaking terrace view at sunset.
name: 5 Lire Matera
address: Via Domenico Ridola, 37, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

detail_description: Vicolo Cieco is a unique and charming wine bar located in Matera. It offers a delightful selection of food, including the famous panino with Basilicata's renowned thick soft bread. The bar is situated in a cave setting and has a cool vintage atmosphere that attracts both locals and foreigners. With its great selection of craft beer and natural wines, it's the perfect place to enjoy wonderful food made from well-selected, fresh, quality ingredients at very reasonable prices.
name: Vicolo Cieco
address: Via Fiorentini, 74, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

excerpt: Tibetan-style suspension bridge spanning a river canyon & accessible via a steep hiking trail.
detail_description: Ponte Tibetano della Gravina is a Tibetan-style suspension bridge that stretches across a river canyon and can be reached via a challenging hiking trail. It's a major attraction, so it tends to get crowded, but the crowds thin out on the other side of the bridge. The hike requires good physical condition and sturdy footwear due to slippery and difficult terrain. It's advisable to carry sufficient water and plan the hike during cooler hours.
name: Ponte Tibetano della Gravina
address: Via Madonna delle Virt, 27, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

excerpt: Pasta, seafood & other traditional Italian dishes served in a quaint, country-style eatery.
detail_description: Nestled in the charming streets of Matera, Osteria MateraM is a delightful eatery that captures the essence of traditional Italian cuisine. This quaint establishment serves up an array of mouthwatering dishes, including expertly crafted pasta and fresh seafood, all prepared with authentic southern Italian flavors reminiscent of home-cooked meals. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, making it a perfect spot for both lunch and dinner. Guests rave about the generous portions that are not only satisfying but also easy on the wallet.
name: Osteria MateraM
address: Via D'Addozio, 4, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

detail_description: Panificio Paoluccio is a tiny bakery located on the main avenue in Matera, known for its beautiful and delicious focaccia. The staff is friendly and speaks good English, offering typical Matera bread made from wonderful flour. While there may be long lines during lunch, the service is quick and polite. Some customers recommend trying the plain and tomato focaccia, while others suggest the eggplant and cheese option.
name: Panificio Paoluccio
address: Via del Corso, 22, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

detail_description: The Complesso Rupestre Madonna delle Virt e San Nicola dei Greci - Sassi is a must-see in Matera. Take a stroll along via Madonna delle Virtu to enjoy the unique coastal scenery and the breathtaking Parco della Murgia Materana. The park, part of UNESCO World Heritage, boasts stunning landscapes with cliffs, gorges, and caves. It's home to around twelve hundred botanical species, making it an ideal spot for nature enthusiasts.
name: Chiesa Rupestre Madonna delle Virt e San Nicola dei Greci - Sassi
address: Via Madonna delle Virt, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

excerpt: Charming, relaxed units with kitchens in a warm, quaint B&B offering breakfast in a nearby cafe.
detail_description: B&B Matera Casa del Sole is a charming and relaxed accommodation located in the ancient part of Matera, carved into one of the famous stone houses known as Sassi. The B&B offers spacious rooms and accommodations with kitchens, providing a unique experience for guests. Situated in the heart of Sasso Caveoso, it offers lovely apartments with incredible views over Matera. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable about the area's history, ensuring a warm welcome for visitors.
name: B&B Matera Casa del Sole
address: Via S. Pietro Caveoso, 49, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

detail_description: Crialoss is a bistro in the town of Matera, which offers a stunning view of the Sassi rock formations. The caf has comfortable tables and chairs, as well as elegant bar stools, giving guests a great place to enjoy tapas and drinks while looking out over the impressive scenery.
name: Crialoss, Panoramic Cave, Caf Bistrot
address: Vico Santa Cesarea, 49, 75100 Matera MT, Italy

excerpt: Cave church with frescoes painted in the 8th & 9th centuries depicting biblical scenes & angels.
detail_description: Crypt of Original Sin is a unique cave church featuring frescoes from the 8th and 9th centuries depicting biblical scenes and angels. Accessing the site can be a bit challenging, with limited lighting and some language barriers for English speakers. Visitors have noted that the audio devices for English speakers may not be of high quality, and some paintings are missing or deteriorated. It's recommended to make reservations in advance, as access may require prior arrangements.
name: Crypt of Original Sin
address: Contrada Pietrapenta, 75100 Matera MT, Italy
